testimony.name: Daisy Calone
key_points: Opposes changes to R4 and R4A districts
Concerned about allowing higher density without parking or community input
Argues that one-size-fits-all zoning doesn't consider neighborhood character
Worries about the impact of half-mile Transit-Oriented Development (TOD) zones on the community
Concerned about the conversion of owner-occupied homes to apartment buildings
Highlights low homeownership rates in the Bronx, especially among minority communities
Requests a full analysis of the potential impact of the proposed zoning changes

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: It is about allowing as of right density without parking, which will give developers an as of right permit to build higher density without looking at community impact of seeking community input.
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: This quote directly mentions the removal of parking requirements, which is a key aspect of the Removing Parking Mandates element of the City of Yes For Housing Opportunity proposal.

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: The Half Mount Transit District will decimate my community and change the fabric of my LaSalle Waterbury neighborhood. That half mile TLD is too drastic and would significantly impact a large land area.
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: This quote directly refers to the Transit-Oriented Development aspect of the proposal, specifically mentioning the 'Half Mount Transit District' and discussing its potential impact on the community.

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: Similarly, other large cities currently have a maximum of 1 quarter mile transit zone from subway transit stations with community input. It should also be on a 10,000 square foot lot, not 5000 because it will convert our current owner occupied homes into medium apartment buildings
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: This quote further discusses the Transit-Oriented Development aspect, comparing the proposed half-mile radius to other cities' quarter-mile radius, and mentioning the potential conversion of homes to apartment buildings near transit.
